Reason: [https://github.com/hudl/replay-mobile/blob/f57c441fd1f49ad67921eb5b7735945f00abf3dc/src/containers/__raw__/VideoContainer.js#L824|https://github.com/hudl/replay-mobile/blob/f57c441fd1f49ad67921eb5b7735945f00abf3dc/src/containers/__raw__/VideoContainer.js#L824]
Error: TypeError
undefined is not an object (evaluating 'l.name')

Logs:
_code=AAEf4t8G1MPS1PTRaNMyPOaRP87XkVWr5NeX4NSj 

[^search-results-2019-10-15T12_12_55.543-0700.csv]

 

It looks like they had 2 iPads on the network. One iPad created the playlist that was ONLY on ethernet, the other iPad (that crashes) deleted that playlist and was on ethernet AND wifi.


h4. Repro Steps

# (Setup) Two iPads on the Network
# On iPad A, create two playlists (Playlist 1, Playlist 2) – It’s important to create _more than one_ playlist, a single playlist will not crash.
# On iPad B, Select Playlist 1 to view the “Clip List” screen
# On iPad A, delete Playlist 1
# On iPad B, delete Playlist 1

resolution.name: Works as Intended

fields.description:
When viewing an IP feed from an Antrica device, the video and timestamp will be about 5 seconds off. If a timer from an Antrica device reads 5:20, the timestamp will display 5:25. 

If you select a moment, the expected video will match what was tagged in HSC, but the timestamp will show similar behavior to the above.

This was reproduced with Replay on develop: http://teamcity.thorhudl.com/viewLog.html?buildId=1191662&tab=buildResultsDiv&buildTypeId=Replay_IOS_Develop
Also on HSC versions 12.0.2, 12.1.0, 12.1.1.

Steps to repro:
1. Setup the Antrica box and get an IP feed with a timer running in HSC 12.1.1.
2. It's important to make sure that the timer matches the HSC timestamp.
3. Open the session in Replay and notice that the timestamp will be off by about 5 seconds.
4. Repeat the steps above with a Blackmagic and notice that the timestamp and video will match.

nonEditableReason.message: Portfolio for Jira must be licensed for the Parent Link to be available.

The actual crash doesn't have a user ID attached to it, but I'm assuming it's the user above because there were only 4 users during that time period that had the 10.14.3 macOS version. This is the only user who didn't have a user ID and had what I'm assuming is a 13" MacBook Pro.

The logs don't give any relevant information, it looks like they did have some issues logging in, though.
_code=2TgN656FESajg1ndO6MYBAn1p0bClX763uj2cwvb 

 

They did have issues with logging in, and the only places we use AppKit in Mac are these two files that have to do with our login window animations:
[https://github.com/hudl/replay-mac/blob/143e5f74275162297d2b350555fe7a8c2d9e1db7/Hudl%20Replay/ThirdParty/CustomSegue/TransitionAnimator.swift|https://github.com/hudl/replay-mac/blob/143e5f74275162297d2b350555fe7a8c2d9e1db7/Hudl%20Replay/ThirdParty/CustomSegue/TransitionAnimator.swift|smart-link]

fields.description:
*This crash will happen if you move the app while you’re syncing the package. That’s not a workflow we plan to build around, so we’re closing this ticket.*



Link: [https://fabric.io/hudl5/mac/apps/com.hudl.replay/issues/ca0838ca571d8f1c63a6ba8b97253552/sessions/latest|https://fabric.io/hudl5/mac/apps/com.hudl.replay/issues/ca0838ca571d8f1c63a6ba8b97253552/sessions/latest]
Frequency: 1
User: 13485816
Device: MacBook Pro Retina, 15", Mid 2015
Version: 1.15

Reason: closure #1 in FFmpegWrapper.launchAsync(with:launchedBlock:exitBlock🙂
Error: Fatal Exception: NSInvalidArgumentException launch path not accessible

If you look at their logs, you can see that the application crashes right after they try to sync a package.

{code:java}2019-09-19 08:27:32,640 ip-AC1F2D64 [INFO ] [Hudl.SportsCode.Webapp.Areas.API.Controllers.LogController] [766] [request_id=5a7d7311] 2019-09-19 08:20:42,764  [INFO] [Audit] Func=Start,Op=App,App=ReplaySync,AuthUser=13485816,CurrentTeam=Unknown,Role=Unknown,Version=1.15.0,DeviceName=Simulator,OsVersion=Version 10.14.6 (Build 18G87),Device=x86_64,AppID=com.hudl.Replay,Build=1.15.0.18,NetworkName=PALCO2_5G,DeviceId=D446A70A-3667-56B0-8105-E7A07AC7CD33,Platform=macOS,NetworkConnectionType=WiFiAndEthernet,SessionId=null,DeviceDisplayName=MacBook Pro de Jon{code}

We then immediately detect a crash

{code:java}2019-09-19 08:27:32,640 ip-AC1F2D64 [INFO ] [Hudl.SportsCode.Webapp.Areas.API.Controllers.LogController] [766] [request_id=5a7d7311] 2019-09-19 08:20:42,835  [INFO] [Application] [crashlyticsDidDetectReport(forLastExecution:)]:303 Crash Detected: Resyncing file:///Users/jonzubillaga/Desktop/PRUEBA%20DOS.SCpkg App=ReplaySync,AuthUser=13485816,CurrentTeam=Unknown,Role=Unknown,Version=1.15.0,DeviceName=Simulator,OsVersion=Version 10.14.6 (Build 18G87),Device=x86_64,AppID=com.hudl.Replay,Build=1.15.0.18,DeviceDisplayName=MacBook Pro de Jon,NetworkName=PALCO2_5G,Platform=macOS,DeviceId=D446A70A-3667-56B0-8105-E7A07AC7CD33,NetworkConnectionType=WiFiAndEthernet,SessionId=null{code}

The path to their file doesn't seem strange, trying to repro by deleting a package while the finder window is open for Mac won't work because the finder will delete the package before you can select it.

fields.description:
Reported by [~accountid:5b69ab79fbe86d3c0f79123a] after a conversation with Pitt WSOC, after about 5-10 seconds worth of time at the live stream, the video player will hit the end of the live stream and display the "Recording Paused or Ended" screen. The video player will not refresh after 30 seconds with an adequate network connection, so I don't believe that we're even in VOD.

*If you back out of the video player and return to the session, you'll be able to view all of the video that you missed.* You'll see a short period of live video, then you'll hit that screen again.

This was reproduced with a hardwired setup, the manifests validator doesn't return anything too alarming, but all of the segments are at a flat 2 seconds.

HSC version: 12.1.1
Replay: 1.45.0

I've attached the playlists from HSC and my iPad.

nonEditableReason.message: Portfolio for Jira must be licensed for the Parent Link to be available.

fields.description:
As of iOS 13, Apple now requires users to have location services enabled to receive networking information. 

Right now, the SSID will only display WiFi in the watch and settings screen.

References:
https://forums.developer.apple.com/thread/117371

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/systemconfiguration/1614126-cncopycurrentnetworkinfo

bq. Important
bq. 
bq. To use this function, an app linked against iOS 12 or later must enable the Access WiFi Information capability in Xcode. For more information, see Access WiFi Information Entitlement. Calling this function without the entitlement always returns NULL when linked against iOS 12 or later.
bq.

nonEditableReason.message: Portfolio for Jira must be licensed for the Parent Link to be available.

fields.description:
h3. Why is this important?
While the error log itself is relatively unlikely and will not disrupt user workflows, logging an error in development builds and unit tests will crash the app and immediately fail the tests, costing engineering time. 

Running the unit tests on Sportscode64 `develop` with sharing enabled will open multiple capture view controllers, which attempts to start HUD multiple times. Attempting to start HUD multiple times will cause an error, since we don't vary the port that the server should listen on. See logs below for additional details.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a capture window
# Open the inspector and make sure "Share with other devices" is checked
# Close the inspector
# Rapidly alternate between hitting ⌘R and ⌘W to close and open the capture view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce Unit Test Failure
# Open a capture window
# Open the inspector and make sure "Share with other devices" is checked
# Run the unit tests in Xcode 


h3. Logs
{code}
2019-08-05 22:26:46,447  [VERBOSE] [HUDServer] [start:]:186 Starting HUDServer App=Sportscode64,AuthUser=,CurrentTeam=Unknown,Role=Unknown,AppID=com.hudl.Sportscode64,Build=11000,Device=x86_64,DeviceName=Simulator,OsVersion=Version 10.14.6 (Build 18G84),Version=12.0.3,
2019-08-05 22:26:46,448  HTTPServer: Failed to start HTTP Server: Error Domain=GCDAsyncSocketErrorDomain Code=1 "Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first." UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first.}
2019-08-05 22:26:46,450  [ERROR] [LogManager] [logError(_:)]:157 failed to start HUDServer: Error Domain=GCDAsyncSocketErrorDomain Code=1 "Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first." UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first.} Domain: com.hudl.Sportscode64 Code: 242271 App=Sportscode64,AuthUser=,CurrentTeam=Unknown,Role=Unknown,AppID=com.hudl.Sportscode64,Build=11000,Device=x86_64,DeviceName=Simulator,OsVersion=Version 10.14.6 (Build 18G84),Version=12.0.3,
Fatal error: failed to start HUDServer: Error Domain=GCDAsyncSocketErrorDomain Code=1 "Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first." UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first.} Domain: com.hudl.Sportscode64 Code: 242271: file /Users/simon/Documents/Hudl/Sportscode64/Sportscode64/LocalFrameworks/Logging/LogManager.swift, line 159
2019-08-06 08:26:46.450064+1000 Hudl Sportscode[37311:3694245] Fatal error: failed to start HUDServer: Error Domain=GCDAsyncSocketErrorDomain Code=1 "Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first." UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Attempting to accept while connected or accepting connections. Disconnect first.} Domain: com.hudl.Sportscode64 Code: 242271: file /Users/simon/Documents/Hudl/Sportscode64/Sportscode64/LocalFrameworks/Logging/LogManager.swift, line 159

fields.description:
When creating a clip that has a long instance name, the clip's name won't ellipse like the moment will.

Steps to repro:
1. Add a moment with a very long name
2. Add that moment as a clip to a playlist
3. Open the playlist and notice that the clip name doesn't ellipse

fields.description:
While in the video player, once I end a session and sync another one, the “Live” icon will be enabled the entire time.

# Connect to a session
# End the session
# Notice the icon is still displayed
# Sync another package
# Notice the icon is still displayed

fields.description:
When disconnecting from the session and scrubbing/seeking to previously downloaded video, the video player will occasionally display the "Video Unavailable" screen.

* Moments with those corresponding segments will also display that screen
* Reconnecting to the network will display that video as you would expect

Notes from Walt:

* This can occur when the iPad "goes to sleep"
* He can't get it to repro every time
* This does scare Walt since the only workaround is reconnecting to the network



Steps to repro:

# Connect to a Classic session
# Make sure all video is coming through to the iPad
# Disconnect the iPad from the session
# Scrub on the timeline and notice that segments will occasionally display the “Video Unavailable” screen
# Reconnect to the network
# Scrub to where those moments displayed that messaging and notice that the expected video will now play

nonEditableReason.message: Portfolio for Jira must be licensed for the Parent Link to be available.

fields.summary: Replay Mobile - Disconnecting and scrubbing will display the "Video Unavailable" screen

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior

When the video player is buffering and a moment is selected, the moment should be played in it’s entirety after the video player is finished buffering and the video is available.

h3. Actual Behavior

When the video player is buffering and a moment is selected, that moment will be skipped and the video player will attempt to play the next moment.

This is easier to reproduce on a "Good" network.

[^ScreenRecording_04-22-2019 14-11-06.MP4]

nonEditableReason.message: Portfolio for Jira must be licensed for the Parent Link to be available.

fields.summary: Replay Mobile - Selecting a moment when the video player is buffering will skip that moment
